(a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.

1.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From en and pros; in front of (literally or figuratively) or time).
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
A prolonged form of a primary verb; to look closely at, i.e. perceive; by extension to visit.

1.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.

Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.

When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.

In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

29.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.

29.str2: From peri and ballo; to throw all around, i.e. Invest.

One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.

Today, now. Neuter of a presumed compound of the article ho and hemera; on the day; generally, now.
And, even, also, namely.
Tomorrow. From a derivative of the same as aer; properly, fresh, i.e. to-morrow.

30.str2: (a) I cast, throw, rush, (b) often, in the weaker sense: I place, put, drop. A primary verb; to throw.

An oven, furnace. Of uncertain derivation; an earthen pot used for baking in.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Much, many; often.
More, rather. Neuter of the comparative of the same as malista; more) or rather.

30.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Of little faith. From oligos and pistis; incredulous, i.e. Lacking confidence.

Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

31.str2: To be over-anxious; with acc: To be anxious about, distracted; I care for. From merimna; to be anxious about.

31.str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
